language.name: Language
language.desc: Select the language for the plugin interface.

showRecordRibbonIcon.name: Show record button in ribbon
showRecordRibbonIcon.desc: Add a ribbon icon to record wordflows to periodic notes. Reload plugin to take effect.

ignoredFolders.name: Ignored folders
desc: Files inside these folders (or subfolders) will not be tracked.
Enter the excluded folder pathes separated by comma ',' or linebreaks.
Recommend to reload plugin after changing this setting.
Folder format validation:

validation.invalid: ⚠ Folder: "{folder}" is not found in Obsidian.

ignoredTags.name: Ignored tags
desc: Files containing any one of these tags in Frontmatter (YAML) will not be tracked.
Enter the excluded tags separated by comma ',' or linebreaks.
Recommend to reload plugin after changing this setting.

keepDeletedFileRecords.name: Preserve records for deleted files
desc: When enabled, records of deleted files will be preserved in periodic notes.
When disabled, records of deleted files will be removed permanently in the next update.

noteThreshold.name: Threshold for notes to record in edit mode
desc: Select a requirement for notes to be recorded in live preview and source mode.
Require edits means you should at least type anything or delete anything, even just a space.
Require focus time means you should leave the note under edit mode over 1 minute.
If require none above, the recorder will track all files you opened under edit mode.

options.ent: require both edits and focus time
options.eot: require either edits or focus time

noteToRecord.name: Notes to record while quiting editing mode
desc: Select the behavior when switching a note from editing mode to reading mode.
Editing mode includes live preview and source mode.
If recording current note only, other notes may not be automactically recorded if you don't manually record.

options.all: current and other notes in edit mode

autoRecordInterval.name: Automatic recording interval
desc: Set the interval in seconds, influencing when the plugin would record all tracked notes and to periodic notes.
Set to 0 to disable.

resetSettings.name: Reset all settings
resetSettings.desc: Reset all settings to the default value.

currentRecorder.name: Current recorder
desc: Select which recorder configuration to edit.
You can add new recorders to save different sets of statistics to different locations.

confirmations.addRecorder:
Please ensure that there are no duplicate record content type per note, or undefined behavior will occur!

**Example allowed** ✅:
- Recorder1:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM-DD
  - Record type = table
- Recorder2:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM-DD
  - Record type = bullet list

**Example allowed** ✅:
- Recorder1:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM-DD
  - Record type = table
- Recorder2:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM
  - Record type = table

**Example disallowed** ❌:
- Recorder1:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM-DD
  - Record type = table
  - Insert to position = bottom
- Recorder2:
  - Periodic note format = YYYY-MM-DD
  - Record type = table
  - Insert to position = custom
confirmations.deleteRecorder: Are you sure you want to remove "{name}"?
confirmations.resetSettings: Are you sure to reset all settings of wordflow tracker?

folder.name: Periodic note folder
desc: Toggle the button to enable dynamic folder. Disabled by default.
Specify the block for the folder of daily notes or weekly note.
folder.dynamicEnabled: Your current periodic note folder looks like this:
folder.dynamicDisabled: Your current periodic note folder looks like this:
folder.confirmToggle:
Please make sure that: 
	1. You will adjust the periodic note folder after toggling dynamic folder. Example formats are as followed: 
		If dynamic folder is enabled, the moment format must be used: 
			[MonthlyLogs/]MM-YYYY
		If dynamic folder is disabled, a folder path must be used: 
			Logs/MonthlyLogs 
	2. Do not forget to do the same changes to other recorders if you want them to record in the same folder!

format.name: Periodic note format

segments: Set the file name (in {link0}) for newly created daily notes or weekly note.

format.preview: Your current periodic note looks like this:

type.name: Periodic note type
type.desc: Select the type of periodic note to determine how the widget is controlled.

templatePlugin.name: Template plugin
desc: Set the template plugin you use to apply template to new created periodic notes.
Currently, only support the templates of core plugin "Templates".
If you are using community plugin "Templater", please use the folder template feature of "Templater".
If you do not need to apply template, kindly use the "default" option.

filePath.name: Template file path
desc: Set the file path for the template file to be applied.
Currently, only support the templates of core plugin "Templates".
If you are using community plugin "Templater", please use the folder template feature of "Templater".

dateFormat.name: Template file date format
dateFormat.desc: {{date}} in the template file will be replaced with this value.
dateFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

timeFormat.name: Template file time format
timeFormat.desc: {{time}} in the template file will be replaced with this value.
timeFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

recordType.name: Record content type
recordType.desc: Select a type of content to record on specified notes.

segments: Modified the syntax with '${}' syntax, see {link0} for supported string interpolation expressions.

insertPlace.name: Insert to position
desc: Insert to this position if no previous record exist.
If using a custom position, the start position and end position must exist and be unique in periodic note!
If using yaml position, the records will be inserted into the frontmatter of the periodic note.

startPosition.name: Start position
startPosition.desc: The records should be inserted after this content. Content between start position and end position would be replaced during recording.

endPosition.name: End position
endPosition.desc: The records should be inserted before this content. Content between start position and end position would be replaced during recording.

sortBy.name: Sort by
sortBy.desc: Select a type of variables to add recording items in a sequence.

timeFormat.name: Last modified time format
timeFormat.desc: Set the format of '${lastModifiedTime}' to be recorded on notes.
timeFormat.preview: Your current syntax looks like this:

idleInterval.name: Idle interval
desc: Interval in minutes when the timer in status bar will pause when idled for a period of time.
Any document clicking, outline clicking or editing behavior will refresh the timer from idling.

autoResumeFocusMode.name: Auto resume focus mode after idle pause
desc: When enabled, focus mode will automatically resume when you are back to the document.
When disabled, you need to manually click the 'continue focusing' button in the widget to resume.

useSecondInWidget.name: Show second in widget pane
desc: Display seconds together with minute in the widget pane.
Will not affect existing data currently.
Required to reload the plugin once changed.

enableOnLoad.name: Enable Widget on loading
enableOnLoad.desc: Enable the side pane widget when plugin loads.

showRibbonIcon.name: Show widget reveal button in ribbon
showRibbonIcon.desc: Add a ribbon icon to reveal widget and refresh the widget content.

defaultViewOnOpen.name: Default view to open
desc: Default view when widget loads
More views will be supported in the future.

switchToFieldOnFocus.name: Switch to this field on focus mode
desc: When start focusing, this reading time field will be automatically switched in the widget.
Only the reading time field in your recording syntax is supported.
Reading time field includes: "${readTime}" and "${readEditTime}".

colorGroupLightness.name: Random color group lightness
colorGroupLightness.desc: Specify the lightness from 0-100 in hsl to generate random colors for file entries.

colorGroupSaturation.name: Random color group saturation
desc: Specify the saturation from 0-100 in hsl to generate random colors for file entries.
You can use space " " to separate numbers to offer multiple options.
If the current saturation options below does not change, the input should be invalid.

tagColors.name: Configure colors for tags
desc: Compatible for both file-based view and tag-based view.
The file with multiple tags will have colors blended.
Different files with the same tag will auto distinct by saturations.

heatmapBaseColor.name: Heatmap base color
heatmapBaseColor.desc: Select the base color for the heatmap. The heatmap will generate gradients based on the hue (H) of this color.

heatmapGradientLevels.name: Heatmap gradient levels
heatmapGradientLevels.desc: Set the number of gradient levels for the heatmap (4-10 levels). More levels provide finer color distinctions.

heatmapWeeksToShow.name: Heatmap weeks to display
heatmapWeeksToShow.desc: Set the number of weeks to display in the heatmap (5-13 weeks). More weeks show more history but smaller cells.

momentValidation.title: Date Format Validation Errors
momentValidation.instruction: Please go to plugin settings to correct the format, or revert to plugin version 1.7.x.
momentValidation.mixedWeekSystems: ⚠️ Conflict: local week system and ISO week system cannot be mixed. See Reference tab for details.
momentValidation.calendarVsWeek: ⚠️ Conflict: calendar date tokens and week date tokens cannot be combined. See Reference tab for details.
momentValidation.calendarVsDayOfYear: ⚠️ Conflict: calendar month/day and day-of-year are mutually exclusive. See Reference tab for details.
momentValidation.dateVsWeekday: ⚠️ Conflict: absolute date and weekday cannot be specified together. See Reference tab for details.
momentValidation.isoWeekYearVsMonth: ⚠️ Conflict: ISO week year and calendar month cannot be mixed. See Reference tab for details.
momentValidation.weekVsDay: ⚠️ Conflict: week number and specific day-of-month cannot be used together. See Reference tab for details.

enableMobile.name: Enforce status bar display in mobile
desc: Enforce the status bar of wordflow tracker to show up in mobile devices.
If you have other css snippets do the same, they may be overwriten.

segments: Customize the content displayed in the status bar for different modes.
Use ${} syntax to insert dynamic values like ${editedWords}, ${editTime}, ${readTime}, etc.

readingMode.name: Content in reading mode
desc: Content to display when in reading/preview mode.
Supported variables: ${readTime}, ${docWords}, etc.

editMode.name: Content in editing mode
desc: Content to display when in live preview or source mode.
Supported variables: ${editTime}, ${editedWords}, ${editedTimes}, etc.

reference.content:
#### Date Format Validation Since plugin version 2.0.0, rigid moment format validations has been imposed to avoid date-counting conflict. Common validation errors and examples: - **Mixed week systems**: Cannot use both local week (w, ww, W, WW) and ISO week (gggg, gg) tokens together. - ❌ Invalid: `YYYY-[W]WW-E` or `gggg-[W]ww-E` - ✅ Valid: `gggg-[W]WW-E` or `YYYY-MM-DD` - **Calendar vs Week tokens**: Cannot mix calendar dates (YYYY, MM, DD) with week dates (gggg, WW, E). - ❌ Invalid: `YYYY-[W]WW` or `gggg-MM-DD` - ✅ Valid: `YYYY-MM-DD` or `gggg-[W]WW-E` - **Calendar vs Day-of-year**: Cannot use both month/day (MM, DD) and day-of-year (DDD) together. - ❌ Invalid: `YYYY-MM-DDD` - ✅ Valid: `YYYY-MM-DD` or `YYYY-DDD` - **Date vs Weekday**: Cannot specify both absolute date (MM-DD or DDD) and weekday (E, ddd) together. - ❌ Invalid: `YYYY-MM-DD-ddd` - ✅ Valid: `YYYY-MM-DD` or `YYYY-[W]WW-E` - **ISO week year vs Calendar month**: ISO week year (gggg, gg) cannot be used with calendar month (MM, M). - ❌ Invalid: `gggg-MM` - ✅ Valid: `YYYY-MM` or `gggg-[W]WW` - **Week vs Day-of-month**: Week number (WW, ww) and day-of-month (DD, D) cannot be used together. - ❌ Invalid: `YYYY-[W]WW-DD` - ✅ Valid: `YYYY-[W]WW-E` or `YYYY-MM-DD` --- #### Supported variables for interpolation | String Interpolation | Description | Compatible Record Types | Example | Note | | -------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | ${modifiedNote} | the Obsidian path to modified note | table, bullet list | Daily Notes/2025-03-23.md | should always be put at the first colomn in a table, or the parent element in a bullet list. | | ${noteTitle} | the basename of modified note, without '.md' suffix. | table, bullet list | 2025-03-23, Untitled, My Note Name | can be used independantly or as an alias for the link. Attention: When used as an alia, must use this format: \[\[\${modifiedNote}\\\|\${noteTitle}\]\] in table syntax (with **one back slash** before the separator '\|'), and this format:
\[\[\${modifiedNote}\|\${noteTitle}\]\] in bullet list syntax (with **no back slash** before the separator '\|') | | ${editedTimes} | the number of edits in a period per note. (**different from** ${editTime}) | table, bullet list | 100 | in Obsidian rule, inputted contents whose intervals are less than 0.5 second will be considered one edit. Each edit can be undone by pressing 'ctrl' + 'z', or redone by pressing 'ctrl' + 'shift' + 'z'. | | ${editedWords} | the number of words you edited in a period per note. | table, bullet list | 550 | equals to addedWords + deletedWords | | ${changedWords} | the net change of words in a note | table, bullet list | 150 | equals to addedWords - deletedWords | | ${deletedWords} | the number of words you deleted in a period per note. | table, bullet list | 200 | | | ${addedWords} | the number of words you added in a period per note. | table, bullet list | 350 | | | ${docWords} | the number of words per document, by the end of last recording. | table, bullet list | 1000 | includes words in YAML(Fromtmatter), which is not included in Obsidian **word count** core plugin. | | ${editTime} | the time when each note is under editing mode and not idle for a period. | table, bullet list | 1 h 0 min, 6 min | when idled, the timer will automatically pause, and you can click the doc or make any changes to reactivate it. (this is **different from** ${editedTime}) | | ${readTime} | the time when each note is under reading mode and not idle for a period. | table, bullet list | 1 h 0 min, 6 min | will only increase in focus mode; when idled, the timer will automatically pause, and you can continue focusing by clicking the 'play' button on widget | | ${readEditTime} | the total of readTime and editTime | table, bullet list | 2 h 0 min, 12 min | the reading time part will only increase in focus mode; when idled, the timer will automatically pause, and you can continue focusing by clicking the 'play' button on widget | | ${editedPercentage} | the rate of edited words to the total words(edited + original), in a period of editing per note. Very useful when you want to track if the edits are little changes or huge efforts | table, bullet list | 55% | the content is html format, and will be styled to a string. (Using string directly is abandoned due to the growing loss of accuracy with the recorder updates this string. ) | | ${statBar} | the portion of original words, deleted words and added words in html format. Very useful when you want to track if the edits are little changes or huge efforts | table | ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c0d929a7-5ea8-4172-9d85-5de5f46e02bd) | the content will be styled to a svg bar, whose color can be customized in styles.css. Example uses the portion of 450:200:150 | | ${lastModifiedTime} | the last modified time of your note that is recorded to periodic note, you can specify the format of this item in plugin settings | table, bullet list | 2025-03-23 16:00 | | | ${comment} | any comment that can be added by the user for existing record in periodic note | table, bullet list | this note is completed! | this plugin will not modify this value, it's all up to you to add anything. | | ${totalEdits} | the total number of edits of all notes you edited in a period. | metadata | 200 | can be used for other plugins, such as generating a heatmap | | ${totalWords} | the total number of edited words of all notes you edited in a period. | metadata | 2000 | can be used for other plugins, such as generating a heatmap | | ${totalEditTime} | the total editing time of all notes you edited in a period. | metadata | 1 h 13 min | can be used for other plugins, such as generating a heatmap | | ${totalReadTime} | the total reading time of all notes you focused on. | metadata | 1 h 20 min | will only increase in focus mode; this can be used for other plugins, such as generating a heatmap | | ${totalTime} | the total of reading time and editing time of all notes you focused on. | metadata | 2 h 33 min | the reading time part will only increase in focus mode; this can be used for other plugins, such as generating a heatmap | #### Read more For more information, visit the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/LeCheenaX/WordFlow-Tracker) or check the [documentation](https://github.com/LeCheenaX/WordFlow-Tracker/blob/main/README.md).

confirmations.focusModeNoReadTime:
**Caution:** There's no reading time property in recording syntax of the selected recorder.

To make use of this feature, it's recommended to click "cancel" button, and switch to a recorder that has the reading time property.

If you are not sure which recorder has, kindly add `${readTime}` or `${readEditTime}` in recording syntax of your table/bullet-list recorder.

Are you sure to turn on focus mode? This will do no harm but the focused time will not be recorded.
